title: White House Staff and Presidential Agendas

content.question: In a press briefing, the White House press secretary issues a statement criticizing members of Congress who refuse to act on the presidentâ€™s judicial nominees to the federal courts. This scenario best illustrates which of the following?

choices.label: Congress does not consider judicial nominations important enough to act on.
Judicial nominees must pass both chambers of Congress, which slows down the process.
Members of the White House staff are strategically used to help the president pass an agenda.
Cabinet members have a tendency to clash with members of the opposing party.

content.answer: Members of the White House staff are strategically used to help the president pass an agenda.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Explain how political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors apply to different scenarios in context.
